5voLt79UD-C_RKMfgCL1qg.text: Crowded but friendly little pub, with good service. My fish and chips were lovely, and they had my favorite beer on tap. A great place to go on your way to or from a concert at Royal Albert Hall.

HPxiVaCD01Tc1DRioI_JRw.text: I came here almost every day for four months when I studied abroad. (not just for drinking at night, but for tea and lunch during the day as well) The staff, owners, and patrons were a fantastic group of people. I loved the menu - the roasted Camembert  with herbs was particularly amazing, and the puddings were heavenly. I wasn't a huge beer drinker, but I was really pleased with the cider and wine selection. The hot spiced wine at Christmas was a treat for us Americans who hadn't had it before. When the weather was nice, socializing and drinking out on the street was a must.  I hear the owners and most of the staff have moved on, and I really hope it hasn't lost its charm. Either way, when I go back to London one of these days the Queen's Arms is #1 on my list of places to visit!

j8GkHfajox1PVOKzL4F1tg.text: Five stars food, drinks and atmosphere.  We visited on a Friday evening so it was busy and we had to wait for a table.  Around 8pm the bar started to thin out a little and became more comfortable.  A really great place, just how pubs should be.

mmL9wCKbNsozTSoaiGrKQA.text: Lovely little place tucked away from the masses. I have judged many a place before on the quality of it's chips and the queen's arms passes with flying colours. Tidy little pies, fat crispy chips, nice beer and a lovely atmosphere - highly recommended indeed!

CFo24pxa_7hCgeNhCyUJ4g.text: I would certainly recommend the Queen's Arms. Apparently pretty popular with the local suit and tie crowd, good food, good beer. It's slightly tucked away on a side street. A fun place to hang in a good neighborhood.

cgQYUJlja94Cc8VNe8bwzw.text: Arrived in London yesterday, and a friend who is a local suggested we meet for lunch here.  I got some very nice, lightly battered haddock and chips, and they had a good selection of beers on tap frolm many countries.  I opted for the German hefeweizen.  There were a lot of men in suits... seems like people on their lunch break, as opposed to tourists.  It was a good place to meet and have a conversation over a beer in the afternoon.

OZaDa0B86U12MpsImfvcGA.text: Right... so this was my local when I lived in SW7, and I'll say this...The bar itself was nice, I did like it a lot, it was literally out my back window, you can't get more local than that.. HOWEVER, if you can't order in a proper British accent, prepare to have the barstaff take the piss. You will get short-changed.  I made the mistake of not actually looking at what I got back a couple of times and found myself a few pounds light. A friend of mine had this happen as well.  A mistake that won't be made again.  Once we caught onto their game and paid for everything with cards, the trips became more enjoyable.  Just be weary, you are in Kensington, tourist capital of London.

SAKvb4_pbcU2xLidqvVzFQ.text: Stopped in for a few pints on a Saturday afternoon.  Not many people there at that time so it was easy to get a beer from the vast selection of ales and lagers on tap. A good feel to this pub.  Must stop back during the peak drinking hours for the true scene.

JhWSB28KZ5DXLa7vnISx3A.text: If you're staying in one of the hotels in South Kensington, this fantastic gastropub is within walking distance and definitely worth a visit.  Great selection of beer, and the food is excellent!

aCYoKQYdi1cciqyPeBxi5w.text: (3.5 stars)Solid little "local" tucked away in the mews behind "Embassy Row" on Queen's Gate. This was my work's local, as I used to work at Imperial College which is but a very swift half's distance away!Good selection of drink, and good choice for lunch as far as "pub grub" standard food is concerned. It's usually populated by students and staff from Imperial & RCA around lunchtime, but gets much busier in the evenings (particularly during Prom season) with attendees going on to the Royal Albert Hall. Service can be a struggle on busy evenings however -- the bar area is not huge, and 20 minute waits to be served are not unheard of. However, if you get there when it isn't packed to the gunnels, it's a highly serviceable and pleasant pub -- better than quite a few others in the local area.PS: Unfortunately, the antique and luxury car showroom which used to be opposite has closed...

BTZGqKH8R5THNcv3vKebXQ.text: Great spot off the beaten path with friendly service, lively crowd and tasty food. I had the sausages with mustard mash and wine sauce - delicious! Since the bar was crowded, a friendly staff member took our order at our seats, which was nice. I could have come back every night while we were in town!

W2VkzEijHpY1T5VQoL04ZQ.text: I first drank here in 1979.  Things were different.  Maggie was in office.   Jimmy Carter was in back on my side of the Atlantic.  We were drinking to forget.  I lived just around the corner on Queens Gate Terrace and this was the closest tap by far.  When the hostages were taken in Iran that November we came here to drink and talk politics.Flash forward to a recent birthday, spent traveling around Europe and back to London in time to celebrate the big day.  Maggie & Jimmy?  Long gone.  The Queens Arms?  Still here, still fun, still pouring fine beers and serving up tasty sandwiches.  Had a bite to eat and a few fine pints, laced with nostalgia and fuzzy memories.  It's bit pricier, but still warm and inviting, and they get an extra star for longevity & endurance (and for not mocking the fake British accent I adopted at first visit, at least while I was in earshot).

yZMVs052VMbeA-UBZvCFeg.text: I first experienced the Queen's right before i started my Semester Abroad in London.  Seeing as I lived around the corner, it proved to be the closest pub, and definitely the best.  The staff (most of which have moved on) are still around, the owner and his wife are fantastic!  They changed their menu 3 times while I was there, and it was all quite good, average price for pub fair, and relatively simplistic, not quite gastropub, but delicious.  This place gets pretty busy at night, especially on weekends, but gets truly packed after shows at Royal Albert Hall.  Good selection of Single Malts, good beer and prompt service.  Great place to grab a quiet drink, or at night share some drinks with friends.  Generally an older crowd, not quite as rambunctious as some of the other places around.  Right before I left they were changing some of their beer selections, but always something good available, and for all taste.  Unfortunately the Vintage Car Dealership has moved down the street a ways, but the Queen's is a fantastic place to grab a pint and something to eat after a bit of adventure in South Kensington

j1kWj3CPHsvgUAi4Ppxk_g.text: I sometimes go drinking here on a Friday night with friends from Imperial. Hidden until the last minute down a obscure side street, the location makes it the ideal spot for standing outside enjoying a few pints of their great selection of ales on tap (Sierra Nevada, Meantime Pale Ale, Discover, Adnams to name a few) The interior is decent, quite spacious filled with a bit of a funny mish-mash of old wooden tables, on which I fully recommend you situate a couple of bowls of their hearty home-made chips. They are truly excellent, and complement the tasty pub food you'll find on offer very well.

vitaIeApQEqCrsQ85e_U1A.text: Tucked away on the corner of the Mews just behind Queens Gate the Queens Arms is a popular watering hole for students and lecturers from nearby Imperial and the RCA.I like the fairly boisterous atmosphere in here and the fact that they serve Fentimans Ginger Beer amongst their good list of ales. The food is average, but edible and reasonably priced too with all sandwiches under £5 and more substantial dishes under £10. It's always nicely busy, but not overcrowded and there's usually a comfortable spot to prop yourself up against even if all the seats are taken. The low lighting from the candles in wine bottles and the chandelier is an inviting touch. When I've been the drinkers have been predominately male and last time I went a fight nearly broke out. This was rather exciting as I didn't know people in South Ken ever resorted to fisticuffs, perhaps just choosing to settle their differences with a severe game of poker instead, so we all found this made the place even more likable. Students hey. Of course it all ended with a laugh and a few pats on the back, the whole curfuffle was probably just down to the excess of testosterone in here.

GL0ZRibuC3BuuARice8_aw.text: Closest pub to my flat. Good selection of real ales. Tried the steak and ale pie and quite liked it, although the portion was smaller than my appetite.I'll be back again regularly. Nice feel.

lXIdczJAG8a-38ByxbS6ZQ.text: Quality establishmen with friendly atmosphere frequented by Imperial college people. Tucked behind some Mews houses its off the main road so it doesn't attract many random punters. Food looks good but did not try it this time around.

myjoiThZTp8JS51UzLItsQ.text: A very fine establishment, hidden away in a little street just around the corner from the Royal Albert Hall (apparently musicians often come here after a concert). Small and cosy, with chandeliers and wooden flooring. We sat down inside to have some food (their Sunday roast was very tasty), but otherwise drinking outside in that lovely little street seemed like an excellent option. Adnams bitter and Old speckled hen on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. chandelier
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. inside
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. the mews

QaaF-GBQpoenBztDrCHDBg.text: Nice pub tucked away down a side mews, not far from Imperial College and the Royal Albert Hall. It wasn't very busy when I was here, and I had my choice of tables or a stool along a shelf by the window. But I've often walked past and seen large crowds standing in the street, drinking and chatting.

dmmtEARHDY9aCWbwW_YSyw.text: A great little pub just round the corner from Imperial College and the South Ken museums. Slightly hidden in the mews, you won't stumble across it unless you know, which means the crowd is locals, lecturers, and students. There used to be a really great boutique car garage across the road that had a McLaren F1, and other such racing gems from the ages, but it's closed now, which makes standing outside not quite as fun. I like the trad curved corner entrance and interior generally. Food good and beer well kept, a gem.

wEJ0i-cRgVMI1mAq_UFkQg.text: Decent pub, good selection of beers on draught.  Had a burger there that was fantastic! Blue cheese and two other types.. Cheddar and grueyer(sp)?

4QqFpQfvmF3yONf356EtOA.text: This place is about a 15 minutes walk away from our Astor Kensington hostel we checked in. It seems to be a genuine London pub without (or at least not many) tourists.One gets beer and food for decent prices. The atmosphere is great sice it's very homely.Unfortunatelly the place closes at 11pm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

F7sDdimgbjy542FBl6562Q.text: I've put off finishing this review for 2 reasons.  1) I wish we had more of this sort of stuff in the states, and 2) I wish I was back in London sipping on a nice cold beer and ordering delectable small dishes from the pub menu (And I don't mean just hamburgers and fries....I mean real gastronomical foods)On our first night here, I was determined to try the fish and chips.  As far as English foods go, besides English Breakfast and perhaps tea time, fish and chips are the thing to go for.  So add in a nice pub around it and lay it on me.  This place was nice.  It's not like the pubs we have in SF where you walk in and feel that all the regulars have no where else to go and so they settle there and the bartender just wants the clock to turn midnight already so he can kick everyone out and bounce on his own.  No.  People come here by choice for the beer, for a hangout, for a grub or two, and the bartenders like what they do.  If I were to compare it to SF, its like Monk's Kettle.  Not your bummish crowd, but your youthful crowd who just want a good beer and some gourmet food to go along.Our dinner was mainly a random selection of small eats and a few big ones shared and devoured like there was no tomorrow.I had english ale throughout the night and was delighted to find myself with a nice buzz while tasting the treats.  The fish and chips were phenomenal.  I'm quite sure it wasn't the buzzed status, but damn, that fish tasted good.  Chips were whatever.  Add that malted vinegar and it'll be gone in no time.We also had some sweet potato steak like fries which was quite average, but provided a nice filler.  Next up, curry samosas.  Yes its an odd item to have at a pub but I'm glad they did because it was certainly good and who knew how well it went with beer.  The last thing was a fried polenta thing, forgive my failing memory.  But anything with polenta is a must for me.  So delicious.And I suppose I fed myself beer for the rest of the night and enjoyed each moment of it.  That's what I call a vacation!

PZsIZx6A-hV0fDICDm57qg.text: Came here during my study abroad trip in London, lived right across the street and hope to come back to visit. They have Strawberry Beer. Need I say more?

e5CRkETh69d6buwRw1Hqqw.text: Small pub with great food. We are from out of country but the yelp reviews were favorable and we were in the area. When we got there the place was packed, but we found a table after a few pints and were not disappointed. The beer was good, service was friendly although it was hectic in there, and the food was outstanding. The fish and chips by far were the best we had on the whole trip. I highly recommend. Even if it's a bit of a trip to get there from where you are staying the food and cozy pub atmosphere make it worth it.

NTeVnaw4HVjyaixA2c6WYQ.text: Found this thanks to Yelp. Great little pub packed with character and a great range of ales. Menu looked great as did the food I saw being bought out. I didn't eat here as it was just a quick pint. Will come again, a great find

Emg4pssOnnnaFaEpxKOMlw.text: Good pub food. We had the fish and chips and the winter vegetable tart both were very good. Great mellow atmosphere tucked away behind the Natural History Museum.

NFkhLDmb4q8_5X8mmJ5xTw.text: The food is hit and miss, but other than that it's a great little pub.  It gets busy on Fridays (especially if it's nice outside) right after work because Imperial's students and staff want to get off campus but not go too far.  It's just the right mix of locals and Imperial people though, and you won't be over run by undergraduates as most of the Imperial people that venture to Queens Arms are post grads and staff.Plenty of beers to choose from, from Cask ales to Franziskaner to Leffe to a few ciders.  Grab a beer and head outside in the summertime.  Order some food and they'll give you a flower!

cmG41lSANwiUeX3wI8h01g.text: I've sat in the arms of the Queen twice in the past 2 years, and enjoyed myself immensely.  Both times it was quite packed - its not a large pub.My favorite visit was when we did not even try to find seats inside, but rather took our pints out into the cobbled alley.  Viewing the vintage sports cars in the showroom in the nice weather was great, and when we wanted to sit down, we just sat against the wall with the other patrons.At one point, a guy drove up in a beautiful red Ferrari, and my semi-drunken, too friendly companion got excited and asked me to take his photo with the car.  He just went right up and leaned on the driver's door and yelled to me "Take my picture!" as the driver shot us a dirty look.  It was funny to me, but of course it wasn't my car.The prices are reasonable, the food is fine, so if you can find this place you'll enjoy yourself - especially in the milder temperatures.

p9XNJeGLaZjg29tthNhfPw.text: Witheringly expensive, lovely interior, staff more interested in their own exploits than in helping you engage in your own. Or even have a quiet drink.That said, it's lovely inside and the food looks good if, as we've noted, it's witheringly expensive. And they've a decent range of beers.

e3aDEdHn51M2Uz4SN_TScw.text: This was the first pub I ever went to in London and from just the looks alone, it didn't disappoint me. Located down a mews, it is really quaint and the inside is welcoming and comfortable. I haven't tried their food but they have a good range of cider on tap and in the winter they have the best ever mulled cider.

KG1Sk1gH71cNQ9y8uZ-g7g.text: popped in here for Sunday lunch before heading to the albert hall. If its a proper Sunday roast you are after, do not go here. It was pre-cooked food, reheated. Never a good sign when it comes out the kitchen 3 minutes after you order. The beef was clearly not just carved and both meals were luke warm. This pub would be fine for an outdoor after work drink in the summer, but in the winter it is cold and pretty unwelcoming. There are much nicer and cosier pubs in this part of the world.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

hBJOyyIXJ3Oh2KfhW4yW_w.text: This place is often absolutely packed, especially in the evenings with the after work or Albert Hall crowd, but it can be surprisingly empty at other times. Quiet little local pub tucked away in a very posh neighborhood. They serve pretty great pub grub and snacks, and have a good selection of ales and ciders. A cut above your usual chain-owned pub in London. It's small and cosy and well looked after. Weekday lunch set menu offers good value for money, too.

C1HHGN4RNbivkGvJw6uiYA.text: Went here on my way to Royal Albert Hall to have quick bite and a pint before the show and this is pretty much the only pub reasonably nearby. It can be a bit difficult to find, but if you prepare yourself with a map or an iphone (with the yelp app installed - obviously) then you should be alright. The place was filled with the likes of me, also on the way to Royal Albert Hall, dressed up and having a nice meal. But there were also a large number of students. The atmosphere was nice, friendly and it felt really good to step into this pub with friendly staff. Just a note, I noticed they had one of those annoying cash machines that charge you £1.75 so I suspect there is a minimum on using cards in the bar. My order was more than 10 quid (the usual limit I think) so my card wasn't rejected but if you only go here for a pint or so then perhaps ensure you got some on you before you arrive (I think the nearest free ATMs are probably on kensingon high street) to avoid the annoying and additional cost of just getting hold of some bills. Ordered a chicken and bacon sandwich with brie cheese (melted) and it was absolutely divine! Love to come back for more items they dish out from this kitchen! So, if you are in the area, this is a safe bet rather than risking going to those tourist-pubs that would only disappoint you...

gjckqzhjIplkbqT7AcAjZg.text: A lovely mews pub for summer, where you can spill out onto the cobbles with pint in hand to catch some evening sun while you prop up against a doorstep or window sill. If the UK every bans drinking in public then pubs like these will die a death.The Queens Arms is pretty, homely and spoils the cider drinker for choice. I'm more of an ale guy, but if sweet, dry or just potent cider is your thing then The Queens Arms will be heaven for you. How do you like those apples!Just one more thing... timing is everything here. Turn up ten minutes too late and the place is full to the brim with Imperial staff and students. But get it just right, and it's a great drinking hole. I've not worked out the timing just yet.

VnnHlcUrSwcGlXtJfiKx8g.text: A lovely little pub well hidden away down one of the Mews off Queens Gate in South Kensington. The owners are lovely, barmen and ladies great and the food is fantastic and very well priced for the quality. This place does occasionally get busy as it is becoming more well known thanks to its popularity with locals and students, and they serve a good variety of drinks and ales in particular. A bit pricey for me, but probably average for the neighbourhood it's in. Very quirky interior with lots of wood to lean against and the tables inside are wooden as well, creating a lovely old fashioned atmosphere, balanced against good hearty British pub grub. A great place to visit. I went here again for dinner the other day and was delighted to see on tap Aspall's Peronelle's Blush, which I had never seen nor had before. A great combination of apple and blackberry, though not the most manly drink I've ever held onto. My burger was lovely as well, and the Bloody Mary sauce that goes with it is great!

KulEQ_IiEaBSJzOpgqd3ww.text: Lucky enough to live around here for awhile. Great pub. Crowded on weekends where the crowd spills in the small semi-private street. Good food as well. A little hipster on weekend days, but a nice place to grab a Fullers at any time. Cool.

BZvREmNIYAfMnnbqGfqI8g.text: Delicious pork & chorizo burger! And the fries were crispy. Nice gastropub that won't break the bank. Definitely recommend for a quick meal and a pint!

EPhvtKgd-EnBhG2XJgcFDw.text: We visited the Queens Arms in early May on our way to a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. It was very early evening. This is a very busy traditional pub set in a quiet mews. The pub offers a good range of cask ales including the excellent Fullers London Pride. We ordered a pint of prawns to share, followed by lentil & spinach burger which comes with chips. The food was excellent apart from the burger bun, which was one of those dense and tasteless American style white bread burger buns - a choice of wholemeal bun would have been good. The service was friendly and efficient. It was very reasonably priced.

xbuZYVO09bgQHUxhW8EMtg.text: You wouldn't know this pub was here, so tucked away it is from the College's and large houses that dominate the area. Situated in a quaint cobbled cul-de-sac, I used to stop off here on the way home, (there is a vintage car showroom opposite with some wonderful old cars) and it is place to go to let the traffic die down before the journey back to Chiswick.  You can waste an hour or so and stand outside in the quiet street and enjoy a nice beer. Very small and it attracts people that are going to the Royal Albert Hall, so it can get amazingly busy and it can difficult to even get in the pub. Food is cheap and cheerful but I would imagine good enough to line your stomach before heading off for some culture. Not a great night time place in my opinion but it does a job as a refuge if you need one as per the traffic home etc.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

sl9Lisyj-nImkRvLUYC1_w.text: What a wonderful pub. Why are all the great ones hidden away?We had delicious salads and small plates. All fresh, perfect size, refreshing. The fish and chips looked crisp and so tempting. Cannot wait to go back. Bright and clean atmosphere in a quaint old pub. Just what we needed.

9dqU4EvYDQA5-OMZ0MOJZA.text: After a long day of travel and arriving at our hotel in South Kensington, my husband and I looked for a nearby, quick dinner option. So glad this place popped up in our Yelp search as most nice sit-down restaurants were crazy busy and most pubs stopped serving food at that time.We ordered a couple rounds of ales on draft that we hadn't tried yet after our travels in Cambridge, plus the following for dinner:There was an awesome bar food special of 13 pounds for any three out of around five options ( a few were out). We got thick-cut sweet potato wedges, "baked brie" (actually just warm with caramelized onions on top and bread on side), and whitebait (amazingly my new fav complement to beers, as they're little, crispy and surprisingly meaty fishes).We split an entrée of oxcheek and kidney "pie" - it was actually mostly meat with a puff pastry on top, which I prefer, that came with side of mashed potatoes (for some reason, a bit cold), and a side of roasted veggies. Very filling!Lastly, we split a dessert - a large order of profiteroles covered in chocolate and caramel sauce with salted caramel ice cream ice cream - loved sweet /salty combo but this was completely too much food. The bartender/server immediately suggested it first-off so we just had to follow up at the end of the night.Service overall was very friendly and bartenders know the food and beer, even with one of them having just started about a month ago. Vibe is a definite hangout for locals. Would return if we could!

bCZI545-z8jDf3i3kOpN1g.text: Excellent fish and chips.Beer selection in very good. Close to the Victoria and Albert museum but out of the man n tourist traffic area.

uYt9bbp1WFdfBtLArDaGdg.text: We were in the area and we wanted to try out an "English Pub". Found this place using yelp. Good food and great service. Seems like a lot of locals eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and Ham Hock pie with mash and season veggies
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. British Burger with pulled pork
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Butternut squash soup

LrFYaVY0oblyWTK-RAGvLQ.text: The Queen's Arms has lovely food and a calm atmosphere should you be looking for a great haunt on a bright Saturday.The menu is well thought out and executed well, and the staff are warm and attentive. A great spot to visit if you are heading over to the Royal Albert Hall and need a bite to eat and a pint ahead of time.

yiKd2sYZTPmx6O37pYsdBg.text: Over grilled chicken club and pan-flavored burger.  Fries were undercooked and unseasoned.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Smallish cooked to hell burger
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken club - drier than it looks

2yg1NtA4Gm-KWzRZJPGH0Q.text: Our first visit to London and our first pub!  We chose it because of the reviews, the location and it seemed like a real neighborhood pub.We ate here twice during our stay and both meals were delicious.  Staff were friendly...and even helped us get acquainted with the 'pub culture' and etiquette.

-6pBPbYm7yOFLGqzHBWFNQ.text: Great pub in London, really cute little hole in the wall. Delicious sandwiches at good prices and a great atmosphere to go with it. If you are in the area, definitely try and stop there for lunch.

DmladwE_KYbffAgAbgEtOQ.text: Overall good meal. The food was super quick and the staff was very nice and accomodating. The highlights were the 3 cheese flatbread and the sweet potato fries, but all the small plates were tasty. The pub quickly filled up around 6 (after work hours) - and for good reasons. The alcohol selection was impressive and everything one could ask for in a local London pub.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Squid, cauliflower, and chorizo small plates

TQNwoxpyFEAFpzFq_1ocbA.text: I went here on a recent trip to London. It was on my list of places to visit and I had to try their famous Sticky Toffee Pudding. I took the underground and walked a little bit to find it. It was a Friday night and was pretty busy. I walked in and tried to find a spot but there weren't any tables available. I tried to see if there was seating at the bar but there weren't any bar stools either (Maybe it's a UK thing?)I eventually was able to get a table and shared it with two lovely women and finally got to dig into my pudding. It. Was. Amazing. It was so awesome that every spoonful I took made me want to order one more so I could take it with me and eat it over and over again! They don't give it to-go, though. I asked.Do yourself a favor and go get some Sticky Toffee Pudding here. You'll love it. Just go on a night that isn't too busy!

fm0yenhgNEjzgaP5Ec_vOg.text: On the recommendation of our bus tour guide, we came here for dinner after a long day of sightseeing. It was a little hard to find, but I'm glad we didn't give up. My husband got sausages and I got fish and chips and we shared a plate of meats and scotch eggs and assorted other tidbits. Everything was delicious! There wasn't really a waiter/waitress, but the guys behind the bar were really nice and despite sitting at an odd small table by the back door, the arrangement was actually pretty charming. The only downside to the night was a drunk 20-something woman loudly singing opera at random times throughout the night... Definitely an experience, though!

kosI-xoC0WNkp_MEB-EKxw.text: We were looking for a place to meet before the Totem show at Royal Albert Hall.  Someone had warned me that they short change tourists who aren't use to the money so I kept a keen asian eye on getting correct change.  Thankfully, I didn't share that experience.They are one of the few places that serve Fruili strawberry beer.  Yeah sorry not a beer drinker.  It's a belgian beer that is 5% alcohol in Vol. and someone told me has antioxidants!  It's super yummy and it's easy to drink.We weren't that hungry but we ordered soup which was a hearty butternut squash soup served with 3 multigrain slices of bread and butter.  Amazing deal considering that the same soup at Borough Market would cost more for less soup and bread.Not bad.  I won't shy away the next time someone suggests Queens Arms but do take note that if you're coming with a large group.  I probably would prefer Gloucester Arms for the larger seating areas, games, location (QA is a bit hidden in the Mews) and free wifi. But QA isn't too bad.

xJSLWMmKnQ_dsFTA22GJNw.text: Popped in on a Friday night at 930pm.  Enjoyed the free range Gloucester Old Spot sausages with beer mustard mash, onion rings and gravy.   The table was provided with Tracklement's strong mustard.   The overall combination was outstanding and I washed it down with a solid pint of the Italian import Peroni which was on tap.  Other than a loud group of young lads debating at the table adjacent to ours, the meal and atmosphere were tremendous!My wife enjoyed the gnocchi with wild mushrooms,roasted squash,spinach and cannelloni beans with a nice glass of red marbec.  She left happy as well, but not gushing as much as myself.

i3-BcMFjE1RbB5Cbo7a-ig.text: For us it was the place that saved the night! With a late open kitchen and on top of that some really great bar food it was a great ending to a day in London.I can't say what it's like when full of people, but late in the evening it was calm, the service was nice and the food was delicious. Try out the sweet potatoes wedges and the goat cheese something-something with bread.And being a cider fan, there was some really nice dry and half dry ciders.In a part of London I assume only inhibited by folks who can afford some expensive housing it was not to fancy of a pub - just folksy and nice. I am coming back!

R33vlo8OUPBnfHgZGXqdzA.text: Place is terrible. Ordered the 5 wing (says the menu) small plate dish, it came out with only 4. Told the server and she said that 4 was correct, I asked her to check the menu. She then comes back and says the chef says if he thinks the wings are big he only serves 4! Ridiculous! Avoid this place!! They are out of several taps as well!

t8ty7R3TAv9YcGSOByaRPg.text: Very friendly services I only stopped In for a couple sneaky pints but I would definitely return. The pub has a very chilled atmosphere and you can hear yourself think.

Q0bZziUipi7147LPObUWMA.text: Struggling with the rating as it is more like a 3.5. The location is awesome, in this charming mews which for spring/ summer would be a great I believe. Inside it is just like any other typical pub and the food was average. I wouldn't go out of my way to go to this pub again but I can't stress how lovely the outside surroundings are...

TWE9iN2IKfhpXOFCPzG9uQ.text: Off the beaten path and more of a local eatery. My family and kids enjoyed it. Loved the scotch eggs. Loved that it was a more mellow British pub. Weren't people getting super drunk or screaming at TVs. I think because it is tucked into a neighborhood. Still a short walk from museums, Gloucester Road, etc. I found this because of Yelp and liked it. I would go back.

tRfwVilZI_-u-mouZ8StLQ.text: Wow!  Best fish and chips ever!  Really crowded today maybe because of clapton's gig at RAH. But the staff were amazingly nice, and the locals in the pub were too.  One amazing lady even dragged over two stools for us to sit at the bar.

E42j00Dqzrz6fRQc2Hf0iQ.text: All I can say is that this place is ok. Just ok. Place was busy on a Wednesday night at 9pm. We wandered in and this place is really tiny maybe a dozen tables. We sat at a high top and wasn't greeted or recognised so after sitting for 15 minutes we realised that we get our own menus and place orders at the bar. Food came out quickly and it was hot but not that flavourful. Really wanted to like this place but wasn't worth the effort getting there.

w6vVZRFBuJ6iswSXjodpuQ.text: We arrived to London pretty hungry and wanting a drink. I found this place on Yelp and saw how close it was to our hotel. They have an excellent variety of beers and ciders on tap. We ordered the poutines, fish and chips and a burger. All of it was amazing!! The staff was super friendly and attentive even thought they were slammed with the after work crowd. We will definitely come back when we are in town.

ywhIbcVdQuIqMSFvB7aV7Q.text: My friend and I visited this pub before we watched Cirque du soleil show in Royal Albert Hall.We were in a bit of a hurry but the pub was full of people and it took a while to reach the casher to order drink and snacks.The food came 15 mins later, which was quite quick considered the congestion. We ordered 3 dishes and all of them were tasty and good size to nibble. The waitors were friendly and helpful despite the busy time, which was great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

7ngGqr9FDEBeP7cA3IwarQ.text: "Hello Love"Those are the first words the bartender said to me when we walked into The Queen's Arms.  Instantly I knew we had picked the right place for our first meal in London. Besides being absolutely and completely charming The Queens Arm's offers up an impressive drink list as well as delicious pub food.  Hubs ordered up a local beer and a classic fish/chips dish and devoured it.  I selected the Chicken & Leek Ham Hock Pie (think pot pie) with the creamiest mashed potatoes and superb veggie medley.  Mmmm so good!  And so filling too. both meals were really good on the portions.  The two rounds of drinks we had were pretty excellent too. I'll go back to London again just so I can have another first meal at The Queen's Arms.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & Leek Ham Hock Pie w/ Mashed Potatoes & Veggie Medley

dvQerDxFWDm8kYizgoLkfA.text: Solid food, good ale, perfect neighborhood spot to enjoy it all in with a cobbled street for a patio.  The duck was very good, as was the Sunday roast for an early dinner.  This is not a loud and/or obnoxious place, more of a neighborhood spot with everything you need to have a great time.

SL2aaOF7x-WEGnlO9weiKw.text: In my opinion, this is the best neighborhood pub in South Kensington. It is by far the most authentic and local feeling; the ambience is always warm and inviting. They have great beers and ciders on tap, and their prices are reasonable too.

-KwUDbiw6yKuiyy9Qvdugg.text: It was the closest pub to my hotel so that was the reason for me going there. Place was packed and I had to borrow a stool from another table to sit at the bar. Staff was great. Food was great.

oNn0o2EaKwkcyLgIjKWRVA.text: Two years ago, I started a month long tour through Europe in London and found myself here after checking into our nearby hostel. It's a real authentic feeling London pub, and was a great introduction to the city of London and Europe as a whole. Drinks were excellent, and the standing area outside was perfect on a nice summer day.

jaTRKcsxaDxB2IbBIBWu1A.text: I'm from Texas, a fact I'll only admit when it involves BBQ or Beyonce.  We came to the Queen's Arms after a long day walking around Kensington Gardens for a refreshing Pimms Cup, got a little too comfortable, and suddenly needed dinner.  I eyed the menu and spotted the brisket burger.  Cautiously optimistic, I settled on it, feeling that my ravenous hunger would more than make up for mediocre pub food.  To my very pleasant surprise, the brisket - and, thusly, the brisket burger - was fantastic!  Tender, flavourful, just really fabulous. Kudos from this Texan.We went on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon/evening and it was never overcrowded.  There was plenty of seating, the drinks were great, the food was wonderful, and everything was reasonably priced.  It felt authentic and lovely, we'll definitely be back.

0ICpzggVNvRC4SX4rEbTgA.text: Lovely pub, close to the V&A, Natural History Museum, Royal Albert Hall, but totally tucked away among quaint mews houses and quiet dead end streets.  I don't want to overweight "authenticity" but I really appreciate restaurants & pubs without beer posters and TVs, and I thought The Queen's Arms was particularly atmospheric.  Moreover I'm so delighted every time there's a homemade veggie burger on a menu (although this seems maybe more common in London than I'm used to?) and this one did not disappoint!  Tasty filling burger and fries, hubs enjoyed his crab cakes and a pint, I had a totally passable glass of wine after establishing maybe once and for all that I just can't do beer anymore.  Don't get old, friends, it might kill your love of beer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Homemade veggie burger, salty tasty fries, aioli.  Crab cakes, salad and a pint for the hubs.

T3ESGvV-C9wKc3yo3iFe8Q.text: This pub is very quaint. It's tucked away and it's your classic English pub. We ordered mulled cider and wine which seemed a bit watered drown. We ordered a healthy platter with hummus and carrots platter which I found to have really few things. Also the carrots weren't peeled!

-d7EIB7o4nkYNp_KpsTV9A.text: This was a great little pub. We came here the day after Christmas. My husband had the fish & chips and I had the parsnip soup. Both were excellent! My only gripe was that it was a little on the busy side and it took a while for them to get us a menu after we were seated. Overall a great place to go for some good fish & chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips and parsnip soup

v57AvV7FTKMHq82_OLAPjg.text: Traditional British pub with decent food and large beer selection. However, I was a bit turned off when I first went up to the bar to order food and was told that we would have to wait 25 minutes to place a food order because the chef was behind.  Ok, no problem but then not 5 min later saw someone walk up to the bar & place an order.  I asked the same bartender & he was supposedly just about to walk over to our table to tell us.  Not sure I would go back.

tXoZyOrfSm6iA43dgYa34Q.text: Not your typical rowdy pub and not your typical pub menu. Awesome dining experience here with our 3 young teenagers. Favorite place to eat on this vacation.  Excellent service. Perfect for early dinner after day at Kensington and Natural History Museum.  Off the beaten path which I love. Go!

F3ZG7MtNIjLxVCQ-3hBwWQ.text: I am thankful my friend and I stopped in for lunch today. The food was tasty and the service was nice, though the bartender was quite adamant we not enter before the stroke of noon.  My friend quite liked the burger special - plenty of food from what I could see. I had the baked brie and raw vegetables and though it was good, I found myself wondering if they could of done something slightly different to make it more interesting and less like the raw ingredients had been thrown on the plate... After all I could do that at home, where i there. The place is tucked away off the beaten track which accounts for a pleasant atmosphere. The prices were reasonable and perhaps if I visit there again I will order something different give them another try.

DDqE1aP0cPFRyiqyr3e-Ng.text: A dimly lit pub in central London, I certainly shall return to the queens arms. This place had beers on tap, friendly/helpful staff and a good burger. I ordered the burger with bacon and fries, it was a bit small for my hefty American appetite so I ordered an extra helping of freshly made homemade onion rings. It was packed on a Tuesday night so I can only imagine a Friday or Saturday evening. Despite everybody chatting the pub never got loud. With limited time in London I heard that this place was good and decided to try it out. I left satisfied. I'll certainly come back here with friends the next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. West Country beef burger with cheddar and smoked bacon

ZK-66ns8WZcoEbllxG31Eg.text: Definitely a local place and one that's NOT full of tourists. That was the main appeal I found while enjoying a pint. The bartender was quite nice and explained to me the beers that are kept on a lower temperature than others. I ordered the traditional scrumpy cider and it was very tasty. The food looked like traditional pub food with fish n chips and bangers and mash.

rGN-lyKOAUOraDhqAX1YaQ.text: This was the first pub I made it to since arriving in London. And the atmosphere was great. Very busy and everybody in good cheer. Good beer (alas, no IPA).

i10z48CNo4zEJ7JWRHlmSQ.text: Spot on Gastropub. The Scotch egg was cooked perfectly, crispy minced meat skin with a soft runny egg centre. The fish and chips were easily one of the best I've ever had - the battered cod was unbelievably crisp, way beyond any Western fry or Japanese tempura I've seen. Seriously, the oil in this kitchen's fryer must be hotter than the earth's molten core! My wife had the chicken schnitzel which was not as impressive - the fillet needed to be flattened further in order to be more tenderized. But a good show overall!

5t63dbKjsqdQjmiq0G-4-A.text: Wow the food in a bar being pretty good ?   Pretty unusual. Had the sampler dishes.  Fish and the octopus.  Overall incredibly good standing room only though so be prepared to wait.

_RjNjWii8FzrG4teQNValQ.text: Only because two of my first food choices were out and I had to settle for fish and chips. The fish was on point, disappointed with the chips but the mushy peas more than made up for it. The peas had a nice and creamy consistency, just delicious. Would have been happy with a plate of mushy peas by itself.

qPX6FbDY9DdG0tfGRVmECw.text: Great atmosphere and food. The savory pies are amazing and the staff was very friendly. Give it a go!

_i_W-dX9YCVYheboalDbbA.text: It was located in a residential area. You order at the bar and seat where you want. We ordered the half chicken and chips and my husband got the bangers (sausage)  and mash. It was a great spot for a late bite with a beer. It is cozy and it was definitely great to be at a local spot.

dzjCG0k9F4AEUHOWdiMC2Q.text: What better way to find a pub than to turn a corner and be greeted with a charming little robin's egg blue spot tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. From the beautiful exterior to the lively interior, we were charmed by The Queen's Arms immediately. We stopped here for drinks and chips in the middle of a weekday and were surprised how full it was. Our service was prompt and polite, and the drinks were delicious and well-priced considering the area. The chips were crisp and hot, just as they should be. I wouldn't consider this pub to be the best we visited in London, but the warm and cozy vibes we got while here, coupled with good drinks, certainly made us glad we found it. We will absolutely come back on our next visit to London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

km7PcmVc45iPwzKfvI1OAg.text: This is exactly what we were looking for. Not a tourist trap by any means. This is a local pub that caters to the locals. If you are looking for an authentic pub experience with a large selection of drinks and offering good food, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips

5le4sihx9t4hxzdBJQihDw.text: Great lunch. Fish and chips were superb. Staff was super friendly. Definitely worth a trip off the beach en path.

ZSQbY_bc9veTx2f-EV98sQ.text: Husband and I enjoyed it! The beer was great (per my hubby as I was pregnant and not allowed to drink) haha! BUT - I did eat a lot, the fish and chips were def authentic but I'm writing this review for the dessert. Try the dessert (sticky toffee pudding) !!!! It's great!

KxTLgPQTPs1nRpiXq7ubcg.text: The best fish and chips we have had in London.Great beer choices, excellent service.Awesome local spot, a little hidden, and will become a regular go too.

zNxPqem-mU_zK53eY6nvmg.text: Nice location on a quiet Mews, good beer selection  including Shepherds Neame , indifferent service & expensive

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

zmXvdxUhDgejZSMgTBFY0w.text: We asked a local who told us about this place.  Such a fun atmosphere!  We felt like locals.  The menu selection was great.  We're splitting a fish and chips, but we wanted to try so much more.  Our neighbor got the vegan lasagna which looks like a good time.  I drooled a little when I saw the burgers being delivered to a different table.  We are having a Meantime London Lager, suggested by the bartender, and it is fabulous.  I wish I could bottle the smell of this place!  Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

de2aZCRC7Of4JGKgTyDIiA.text: Great place in a beautiful part of the city. The Fish and Chips are everything you could ask for. The service is nothing great, but it's not offensive either.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

RIlVEn7KbCTIiB3CXRxWKw.text: Looks like a fun and lively bar despite it being a neighborhood, but I came here to eat. I ordered the chicken, mushroom, and leek pie, which came with carrots and mash. My husband ordered the fish and chips.Everything was on the bland side and needed seasoning. Fish seemed to be undercooked a little. Service and atmosphere was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken, leek, and mushroom pie with mash

lqtLtlQI1lNU32t3hZschg.text: Nice dinner spot. It is kind of tucked away in Kensington. They have quite a few beer options on tap, plus some bottled cider. I had the fish and chips for dinner. It was very good. It was typical British fare, no complaints there. It came with fries and mushy peas. My sister had the chicken pot pie which was also tasty. It wasn't overly expensive, definitely worth a stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pot pie
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips

ubaoL8Ono_lziCGzzcwCqA.text: This is a totally charming pub in a really charming street. It has a warm atmosphere and a good selection of beer. It gets quite crowded after work but you can call ahead and book a table. A great post museum stop!

0X_YoJCC7F3jeHYYe6cXSA.text: Nice wholesome pub in a quiet lane in Kensington.  Had a light ale and fish and chips.  All pretty good with fish fresh and a crispy batter.  Yummy. Not the best pub l have had but awesome for a quick Friday afternoon local with no touristy hassles.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Bam
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Tasty
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Cute

jslQSO8YIqxDCHMIQOh7VQ.text: Super cute pub but what we ordered was a bit disappointing. The beer was warm and food was just meh. I had the quinoa burger and it was flavorful but extremely dry, like desert dry in your mouth. I tried to add mustard but their mustard is wicked hot; think wasabi hot. My hubs had risotto and it was good! I might eat here again but I would not have the veggie burger.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Risotto
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Veggie burger

h5p9Nvl0h1iG3CN_9YDsLA.text: The quintessential London pub.  Great selection of beers on tap, good food, and friendly staff.   Found seating without a wait even on an August Saturday night.

gAl9_KTYjTkW5y3RzaAQzQ.text: We found this place on yelp. Base of all the other reviewers we ordered fish And  chips and 2 beer.My beer wasn't cold enough which I didn't like it but my boyfriend's was good. The food was ok nothing so special. I had better fish and chips before.The place is so cute and crowded but the food was very ok.The service is not good at all.

wWlVPllX2jWPoXKEBA0yjA.text: This place has the best Sticky Toffee pudding and Sunday Roast!!!  Excellent service. Perfect place for early dinner after a day at the Kensington Garden and Other touristy places. Thank you for a very good experience! Will definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Best thing ever!! Lol This place have very good local drinks too. Will definitely come back when we're in London again

SMZdZ-6BpZDBEgY6AQQVnQ.text: Nice pub tucked behind Albert Hall, V&A, Imperial War Museum and Natural History Museum. It's in a Mews so it's quite a peaceful setting. It's popular for Roasts and other lunches. A good looking pub. It's nice to stand outside in the summer but there's no outside seating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom

Z2FJ2Mp2ywaaKh3v1YeFxg.text: First place I visited after a long journey to London; and it was the ideal introduction to London! Very busy and jovial on a Friday night with almost exclusively locals off work for the weekend. Jam packed, but we were by some miracle able to snag a cozy table. The interior is warm and rich, very comfortable. Had some dark copper ales that were some of the best beers I've had in awhile. The food here is divine, comforting, and very very affordable! Had a Brie Walnut Souflee for an appetizer that was very gourmet!Both had the Fish 'n' Chips which were quintessentially perfect! Big piece of crispy, flaky fish, malt vinegar, big fries, and mushy peas. The whole experience made me really feel like I am in London and didn't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of The Queen's Arms - London, United Kingdom. Fish 'N' Chips

747iO-HJitLhtNF9BPDTcA.text: A wonderful local pub.Lots of drinks offered.It was located on a small street.Usually in the afternoon after 5pm,it was filled with students and staff from Imperial college and the pub got quite busy.Weekend would be better if you want to have some nice food here.Staff here were really nice and helpful.High recommended.

5Ajty8Q9JaBxZPFs0vrOmA.text: Nice atmosphere and he food is really good! =D
